text: I love to make savory tarts when I'm
entertaining and store-bought puff
pastry is a wonderful way to use a smart
shortcut when you have a lot to do
before your guests arrive we have three
really excellent recipes for puff pastry
tarts in this brand new book Martha
Stewart's appetizers lots of excellent
recipes the best part about making tarts
is you can start with store-bought puff
pastry like this one here look for all
butter that's very important much better
flavor than those that use oils I have
two here in front of me I have asparagus
and Gruyere and this is potato and
rosemary and the one I'm making now is
harissa with goat cheese and fresh herbs
so roll the pastry out to attend by 16
and you should also have your oven
preheated to 400 degrees store-bought
puff pastry range in size anywhere from
11 ounces to a full pound per piece for
the trimming a ruler is handy you should
have one and it's best to score it first
so that's ten and we want to have
straight edges so I'm going to mark on
both sides and then 16 now for the
trimming and you'll want this onto a
baking sheet lined with parchment paper
so I like to just take the edge of the
dough up onto the rolling pin right see
some excess flour there get that off of
there it's not useful to us anymore
a wallah now on to a parchment lined
sheet tray and you can just start at the
end closest to you and just unfurl it
now for the next step we want to create
a 1-inch border that's going to puff up
around to the center so again you'll
want your ruler and we're going to mark
an inch inside so that's an inch and
then again down here and this is just
our reference point so that when we line
up the ruler we have an exact 1-inch
border like that so I'm going to start
with the longer sides and by scoring
we're just running the knife through the
dough but not all the way through the
dough so it's just a light mark and then
again on the top and bottom
looking good so far now before we put
our harissa mixture on you want to dock
the dough inside the border and what
this does is it prevents the tart from
puffing way up and in throwing your
toppings everywhere so for the base the
harissa that I mentioned earlier that
also gets diluted with two tablespoons
of extra-virgin olive oil
harissa is a chili paste from North
Africa and it's made from sun dried
chilies garlic olive oil and spices so
just stir together the olive oil in the
harissa till it's evenly combined and
then brush it over the pastry inside the
border you want to keep the borders
clean when I get it all out of there has
a beautiful vibrant red color to spread
this evenly to the edges of the border
you can also dilute tomato paste with
olive oil if you want a tomato tart and
this goes into your oven for 15 minutes
this is only five minutes away from
being ready to devour one more step is
putting goat cheese on and then back
into the oven for five minutes it's just
the time you need for the tart to finish
cooking and the cheese to melt slightly
into the pastry dough and this is a 4
ounce log of goat cheese
that's it back into the oven 5 more
minutes this is just about ready to
serve now we just want some fresh herbs
on there flat leaf parsley and some mint
also if you have other herbs in your
garden you could certainly try those
little thyme or oregano and a sprinkling
of flaky sea salt like Malden and that
is ready to eat in addition to this puff
pastry tart in the two variations you've
seen today there are over 200 more
recipes in this book including cocktails
so there's something for everyone in it
check it out
you
